analyzed: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Feeling has the characteristic of experience.

original: de yang dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ma yin pa de dag nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dge ba rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ma yin pa de dag nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: It is the experience of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain, which are the agreeable, disagreeable, and neither agreeable nor disagreeable results of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous actions, respectively.

original: de bas tshor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de bas tshor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ma yin pa'o //

original: 'du shes ni 'du shes te /
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'du shes te /

translated: The characteristic of perception is the perception of objects. The objects of perception are fourfold: seen, heard,üîΩcognized, and known.

analyzed: de la mthong ba ni gang mig gi yul du byas pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gang so sor nyams su myong bar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: 'du byed ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Conditioning is the characteristic of formation.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba la yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs su yang @37a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba la yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs su yang @37a * //

original: sems kyis rab tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis rab tu spyod pa'o //

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /

analyzed: rjes su 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir gnas skabs thams cad du 'byung ba chen po bzhi po rnams gzung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Whatever form there is, in all cases, it should be understood that the four great elements serve as its foundation, because it is not tenable that it is different from them, and because it does not exist apart from them.

original: yang de rnams ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ngo //
analyzed: yang de rnams ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ngo //

original: dbang po rnams ni drug go //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni drug go //

analyzed: yul rnams kyang drug go //

analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni drug go //

analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams go bar bya ba'i phyir bsgrags so //

analyzed: kye ma dman pa gsang ba 'di ci skye bo thams cad kyi yid yin na /
